message.entry: ReadSize must be a positive integer or the character vector, ''file''.
Do not specify both RowsPerRead and ReadSize. RowsPerRead has been removed. Use ReadSize instead.
{0} rows
NumHeaderLines must be a nonnegative integer.
MissingValue must be a numeric scalar.
CommentStyle must be a single character vector or a cell array of two character vectors.
{0} must be logical 1 (true) or logical 0 (false).
RowDelimiter must be a single character or one of the character vectors ''\\r'', ''\\n'', or ''\\r\\n''.
TreatAsMissing must be a character vector or a cell array of character vectors containing nonnumeric text.
Variable names are detected from the file but are replaced by the value of VariableNames. Verify that the values of ReadVariableNames and/or NumHeaderLines are correct.
The size of {0} does not match the size of {1}.
If you specify SelectedFormats, you must also specify SelectedVariableNames.
Do not specify both {0} and format specifiers that skip fields using an asterisk (''*'') in TextscanFormats.
SelectedFormats must not contain format specifiers that skip fields using an asterisk ('*').
A format specifier cannot contain only literal text. Include a format specifier that contains a '%' character.
Each variable name must correspond to a single format specifier.
{0} cannot be empty.
{0} cannot contain an empty character vector.
SelectedVariableNames must be a unique subset of VariableNames.
VariableNames and TextscanFormats must be specified during construction.
Text Format Properties:
Properties that control the table returned by preview, read, readall:
Properties that control the table returned by {0}, {1}, {2}:
Advanced Text Format Properties:
Appending a space (' ') to the specified Whitespace characters.
{0} must be a character vector or a cell array of character vectors.
{0} must be a character vector.
Cannot detect {1} from file: ''{0}''. Specify {2} when you create the datastore. Verify the Text Format and Advanced Text Format Properties.
TextscanFormats cannot contain only format specifiers that skip fields using an asterisk ('*').
Reading the variable name ''{0}'' using format ''{1}'' from file: ''{2}'' starting at offset {3}.
The data in file: ''{0}'' does not appear to be tabular, with the same number of fields in each row and in each column. Verify the Text Format and Advanced Text Format Properties.
Cannot open file: ''{0}'' for reading.
